content: from * end p1 k2 row 9 p2 *k1 p1 repeat from * end k1 p2 row 10 p1 *k1 p1 repeat from * row 11 k1 *p3 k1 repeat from * row 12 p1 *k3 p1 repeat from * row 13 k1 p1 return stitch back to left needle pnso bring stitch back to right needle k1 p1 for 5 sts ending in a knit then p1 ret to ln pnso bring st back to rn k1 p1 for 13 sts ending in a knit then p2tog k1 p1 for 5 sts ending in a knit then p2tog and k1 29 sts row 14 k2 *p1 k3 repeat from * end p1 k2 row 15 p2 *k1 p1 repeat from * end k1 p2 row 16 p1 *k1 p1 repeat from * © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 4 row 17 k1 *p3 k1 repeat from * row 18 p1 *k3 p1 repeat from * row 19 p1 k to 2nd last st p1 row 20 k1 p to 2nd last st k1 row 21-26 alternate between row 19 and 20 for 6 row ending on a purl row cast off all 29 sts leaving a long tail for making a clasp cape should look like fig 5 when completed you will notice at the top collar area that the collar will naturally roll down with the wrong side of the stocking stitch showing i then thread the leftover yarn tail in a yarn needle and move the yarn tail with small sewing stitches down to the beginning of the stocking stitches then i use a 1 5mm crochet hook to pull up a loop and to make a clasp by chaining 35 stitches or whatever is the right length to fit around your toad s mouth pouch and then i make a loop with the last few stitches and slip stitch them to the main chain see fig 6 to make a button clasp next i sew on a small bead or button to the other side of the collar and attach the clasp to it and then i weave in all the loose ends if crocheting is just not your thing an i-cord chain will work just as well fig 5 fig 6 fig 7 © maggie l wood © mage wood whimsies 5 and your toad witch or wizard hat and cape are complete i do so hope you enjoyed making your little toad witch or wizard hat and cape if you have any questions concerning the pattern you can email me at magewood@hotmail com or through @magewoodwhimsies copyright information this pattern was designed and written with a lot of love by me maggie l wood a k a mage wood whimsies please do not distribute this pattern yourself and please do remember to give credit to me as the designer of the pattern when posting or selling your work made with this pattern online as i so look forward to seeing your creations
